alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:44AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Benton, northwestern Crawford, western Washington, southeastern Craig, central Rogers, Delaware, northeastern Sequoyah, Mayes, Adair and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 144 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Verdigris to 2 miles northeast of Leach to 2 miles north of Short. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Siloam Springs... Stilwell... Jay... Natural Dam... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Catoosa... Grove... Prairie Grove... Verdigris... Gentry... Lincoln... Chouteau... Chelsea... Inola... Westville... Locust Grove... Salina... West Siloam Springs... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 240 and 278. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
